instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1989 820-00850 -  don't turn on
threads.message:
the fan i spinning
i get 20v 0.65A
screen dont turn on 
i booted once, then nothig 
CPU get hot 
PPVCC_S0_CPU 1.8v
PPVCCSA_S0_CPU 1.025v
PPVCCIO_S0_CPU 0.9v
PPVCCEDRAM_S0_CPU 0v

what i have to verfiy after ?

threads.title: A1989 820-00850 -  don't turn on
threads.message:
Any history available?
It is recognized in DFU?

threads.title: A1989 820-00850 -  don't turn on
threads.message:
I can't enter DFU mode, but always I have error when I try revive or restore.
The MacBook was filed with dust and nicotine vapeur It was to dirty inside.
When I removed the motherboard and cleaned it works for once after the ultrasound cleaning it return back in the first state.

threads.title: A1989 820-00850 -  don't turn on
threads.message: If stopped working after ultrasound cleaning, you may have knocked off component, or broken trace.
